content.text: In this lesson, you'll learn how to ask for help in a Dutch supermarket. Let's start with how to get someone's attention politely.

data.tip: This sounds like the English word 'var'. The Dutch 'w' is softer than in English.

content.title: Asking for Help
content.setting: You are in the supermarket and see an employee. Get their attention and ask for help.

conversation_flow.title: Ask where to find the milk
Ask where to find the bread

content.text: Good job! Now let's learn how to ask for specific items and quantities.

data.tip: The 'g' sound at the beginning and end is a soft, throaty sound, typical in Dutch.

content.title: Asking About Products
content.setting: The employee just told you where the bread is. Continue the conversation.

conversation_flow.title: Ask for 500 grams of grapes
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Het brood is bij de bakkerij. Nog iets?

conversation_flow.title: Ask if the cheese is on sale
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Oké, 500 gram druiven. Anders nog iets?

conversation_flow.title: Thank the employee
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Ja, de kaas is in de aanbieding.

content.text: Great! You have all your items. Now it's time to pay at the checkout ('de kassa').
You can use 'Alstublieft' when you ask for something (please) and when you give something (here you go).

content.title: At the Checkout
content.setting: You are at the checkout with your items. The employee has finished their previous sentence with 'Fijne dag!'.

conversation_flow.title: Respond and pay
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Ja, natuurlijk. Dat is dan twaalf euro, alstublieft.
